articles.title: Kim Jong Il Inspects Major Industrial Establishments in Hamhung
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Inspects Major Industrial Establishments in Hamhung
Pyongyang, January 30 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il provided field guidance to major industrial establishments in Hamgung energetically accelerating the drive for significantly improving the standard of people's living.
					 The first leg of his guidance was the February 8 Vinalon Complex.
					
					 After being briefed on the complex before its long-term plan, he went round various places of the complex including the vertical spinning shop and theconverting work-team to learn in detail about production and construction there.
					
					 He was greatly satisfied to learn that the workers of the complex are making uninterrupted innovations and progress in production and construction with the same vim and vigor with which they brought such great event to the country as mass-producing vinalon.
					
					 He met Ri Yong Suk and other workers who were converting vinalon with all sincerity and talked to them. He extended a warm salute to the workers of the complex working hard to produce and supply quality clothing materials to people.
					
					 The February 8 Vinalon Complex has a very important duty and role to perform as it is directly related to the people's living, he said, setting forth important tasks before it.
					
					 The next leg of his guidance was the Ryongsong Machine Complex.
					
					 The complex intended to import some equipment necessary for gas adsorption and compressors for compounding ammonia from a foreign country so as to wind up the project for gasification as early as possible but it refused to provide them under the pretext that they are products for dual use. Its officials, workers and technicians, however, successfully manufactured them by themselves in a brief span of time by fully displaying the revolutionary spirit of self-reliance, thus demonstrating once again the indomitable creative power of the heroic Korean working class.
					
					 After exchanging a salute with the officials present to greet him, he went round different places including the compressor shop and large machine shop to acquaint himself in detail with production there.
					
					 Watching giant equipment at work including the ammonia compounding tower, the concentration and separating tower and hydrogen refining tower for hours, he was greatly pleased to learn that the workers of the complex successfully manufactured modern equipment for Korean-style gasification by their own  efforts and with their own technology.
					
					 The successful manufacture of equipment for gasification is the precious fruition of the mental power displayed by the workers of Ryongsong in the spirit of self-reliance, he said, praising the officials, workers and technicians of the complex for performing the great feats to go down in history along with the Songun era by devoting ardent patriotic enthusiasm and all their wisdom and energies.
					
					 He set forth tasks to be fulfilled by the complex, noting that the complex, one of the nation's giant custom-built equipment producers, has a very important role to play in accomplishing the party's cause of building a thriving nation.
					
					 The last leg of his guidance was the Hungnam Fertilizer Complex, one of the nation's large fertilizer producers.
					
					 He first visited the construction site of the gasification process.
					
					 After being briefed on the construction before a huge map showing the gasification process, he looked round the construction site to acquaint himself in detail with the progress made in the project.
					
					 He said that when the gasification process is completed, it will be possible to establish a more solid Juche-oriented fertilizer production system based on the locally available raw materials and bring about a decisive turn in solving the food problem.
					
					 He made the rounds of various production processes including the water electrolysis shop to learn in detail about the technological updating and production there.
					
					 Noting that the complex's position and role are very important for bringing the agricultural production to a high level, he advanced important tasks to be fulfilled by the complex.
					
					Hamhung City has an important role to play in the nation's economic development as it has a lot of big factories which are important for solving the issues of clothing, food and housing, he noted, underscoring the need for the city to play a vanguard role in improving the standard of people's living and building a thriving nation.
					
					 He was accompanied by Kim Ki Nam and Hong Sok Hyong,  members of the Political Bureau and secretaries of the C.C., the WPK,  Kim Kyong Hui, member of the Political Bureau and department director of the C.C., the WPK, Thae Jong Su, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK, Ju Kyu Chang, alternate member of the Political Bureau and department director of the C.C., the WPK, and Kwak Pom Gi, chief secretary of the South Hamgyong Provincial Committee of the WPK.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Enjoys Performance Given by Art Groups of Employees
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Enjoys Performance Given by Art Groups of Employees
Pyongyang, January 30 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il enjoyed a performance given by the art groups of employees of the Hungnam Fertilizer Complex and the February 8 Vinalon Complex.
					 Their colorful performance included numbers like "Appreciation with Loving Care", "We Will Hold the General, Our Father in Higher Esteem" and "Vinalon, Pride of My Country".
					
					 The performers enthusiastically sang of their happiness and pride of energetically making a breakthrough towards the building of an economic power as vanguard of revolution who have grown up under the loving care of Kim Jong Il. They also powerfully demonstrated the militant spirit of the heroic Korean workers dashing ahead like the wind towards the eminence of a thriving nation full of confidence and optimism about sure victory.
					
					 He expressed satisfaction over the splendid performance presented by them with numbers which are of great cognitional and instructive value as they truthfully represented their life. He highly appreciated their successful performance and extended thanks to them. 
					
					He advanced the tasks to be fulfilled to intensify the mass performing activities. 
					
					 He expressed great expectation and belief that the working class of the DPRK who take the lead in upholding the cause of the party and the leader would make uninterrupted leap forward and innovations in production and construction, loudly  beating the drum for the revolution in the future, too, as befitting a shock brigade in the drive for bringing about a signal improvement in the standard of people's living and creators of new culture in the era of Songun.
					
					 Among the audience were  Kim Ki Nam and Hong Sok Hyong,  members of the Political Bureau and secretaries of the C.C., the WPK,  Kim Kyong Hui, member of the Political Bureau and department director of the C.C., the WPK, Thae Jong Su, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK, Ju Kyu Chang, alternate member of the Political Bureau and department director of the C.C., the WPK, Kwak Pom Gi, chief secretary of the South Hamgyong Provincial Committee of the WPK, and leading officials of the complexes.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets AU Summit
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets AU Summit
Pyongyang, January 30 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Saturday sent a message of greetings to the 16th Ordinary Session of the Assembly of Heads of State and Government of the African Union.
					 Kim in the message extended warm congratulations and cordial greetings to all heads of state and government and delegates present at the session in the name of the DPRK government in connection with the opening of the session in Addis Ababa amid the great expectation of the peoples of the African countries and deep concern of the international community.
					
					 The positive initiatives and efforts of the AU to settle continental issues including the political and economic integration by the efforts of the Africans in a peaceful environment, opposed to all sorts of use of force and its threat, are powerfully encouraging the regional people to build a new society and arousing widespread support and sympathy of developing countries, the message said.
					
					 Reaffirming the Korean people's firm solidarity for the just cause of the African people to build an independent and prosperous continent, the message expressed the conviction that the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and the AU and its member nations would steadily grow strong.
					
					 It expressed the hope that the current session which will mark another important and significant occasion in achieving the great unity and integration of Africa would yield good results in conformity with the expectation and desire of the member nations.

articles.title: New Year Reception Given for Chinese Officials
articles.content:
New Year Reception Given for Chinese Officials 
 Pyongyang, January 30 (KCNA) -- A New Year reception was given at the DPRK embassy in Beijing on Jan. 28 in honor of officials of the International Liaison Department of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China.
					 Present there on invitation were Head Wang Jiarui, Deputy Head Liu Jieyi and other officials of the International Liaison Department.
					
					 Ambassador Ji Jae Ryong and staff members of the DPRK embassy were present there.
					
					 A similar reception was given at the DPRK embassy on Jan. 18 in honor of officials of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of China.
					
					 The DPRK Consulate General in Shenyang hosted a reception for officials in charge of foreign affairs of the Liaoning Provincial People's Government on Jan. 21.

articles.title: Preparations for Kimjongilia Festival Brisk
articles.content:
Preparations for Kimjongilia Festival Brisk 
 Pyongyang, January 30 (KCNA) -- Preparations for the 15th Kimjongilia Festival are making successful progress at their final phase.
					 Officials of the Korean Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Committee have completed the layout for the venue of the festival, posters and diplomas according to the theme of the festival "February when Kimjongilias are in full bloom is the spring for all people to sing praises of Kim Jong Il." Efforts are now being exerted for decorating the venue in a peculiar manner.
					
					 Kimjongilias are now coming into beautiful bloom in every greenhouse despite unusual long spell of cold.
					
					 Service personnel of the Korean People's Army and officials of the Ministry of People's Security have thousands of potted Kimjongilias ready for display.
					
					 Officials of the ministries of Light Industry, Agriculture, Metal Industry, Railways and Chemical Industry are busy cultivating flowers and preparing peculiar stands for their display.
					
					 Potted Kimjongilias are doing particularly well in the greenhouses of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, the General Bureau for Service to People and the Taehung Guidance Bureau where thorough measures are taken for ray, temperature and humidity control for flower cultivation.

articles.title: Poster for Kimjongilia Festival Produced
articles.content:
Poster for Kimjongilia Festival Produced
						
 Pyongyang, January 30 (KCNA) -- A poster for the 15th Kimjongilia Festival was produced in the DPRK. 
					 Depicted on the poster are beautiful flowers of the sun in full bloom all over the world, Jong Il Peak towering high and Kim Jong Il's birthplace in the Paektusan secret camp.
					
					 The poster has on its upper part letters "Celebration of February 16" and festival logo and on its lower part letters "The 15th Kimjongilia Festival." The venue of the festival and its period are given there.

articles.title: US Forward-deployment of Its Mobile Task Forces Flailed
articles.content:
US Forward-deployment of Its Mobile Task Forces Flailed
 Pyongyang, January 30 (KCNA) -- U.S. nuclear-powered carrier Carl Vinson entered Pusan Port of south Korea along with a cruiser belonging to the carrier flotilla and two more cruisers Jinhae Port on Jan. 11. Timing to coincide with this, the U.S. is contemplating dispatching mobile task forces belonging to the U.S. Seventh Fleet to Japan.
					 Commenting on these moves, Rodong Sinmun Sunday observes: 
					
					 The U.S. is forward-deploying its mobile task forces in Northeast Asia in a bid to finally round off the preparations for a war of aggression against the DPRK.
					
					 It is the scenario of the U.S. imperialist war-like forces to deploy huge mobile task forces in south Korea and its vicinity in advance and use them anytime for launching a surprise armed invasion of the DPRK. 
					
					 Their forward-deployment in Northeast Asia is part of the U.S. Asia strategy.
					
					 The main thrust of that strategy is to contain by force the influence of other big powers and its expansion in this region and establish the U.S. unchallenged order of domination there. The U.S. is set to back the strategy with the forward-deployment of powerful forces.
					
					 The U.S. imperialist aggression forces forward-deployed in south Korea and Japan are not aimed to "settle" instability but aggravate the situation and launch armed invasion of the DPRK and other countries.
					
					 The prevailing situation requires the DPRK to be ready both for dialogue and war.
					
					 The DPRK has already clarified its stand to settle the prevailing situation through dialogue and negotiations.
					
					 The U.S. has neither ground nor pretext to forward-deploy its aggression forces in south Korea and its vicinity.

articles.title: US-S. Korea Urged to Respond to Dialogue with DPRK
articles.content:
US-S. Korea Urged to Respond to Dialogue with DPRK
 Pyongyang, January 30 (KCNA) -- Minjok Thongsin, an Internet newspaper of Koreans in the United States, on Jan. 26 posted an article urging the U.S. and the south Korean authorities to come out for dialogue and negotiations for peace on the Korean Peninsula. 
					 The article said that the situation on the peninsula is so tense that it is standing at the crossroads of war and peace due to the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK.
					
					 If the hostile relations between the DPRK and the U.S. and those between the north and the south of Korea persist in the Korean Peninsula and they lead to military clashes and a war, it will be only Koreans who will suffer from them, the article held, and went on:
					
					 In connection with this situation, the north proposed opening north-south high-level military talks for defusing the tension on the peninsula and then the spokesman for its Foreign Ministry issued a statement. 
					
					 The article urged the U.S. and the south Korean authorities to lend an ear to the voices calling for peace and immediately respond to dialogue and negotiations with the north.

articles.title: S. Korea Urged to Contribute to Achieving Peace on Korean Peninsula
articles.content:
Halt to Suppression of Pro-reunification Forces in S. Korea Demanded 
 Pyongyang, January 30 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities should make a positive contribution to achieving peace on the Korean Peninsula, urged the Association of Koreans in Americas in a statement on Jan. 20.
					 The statement accused the south Korean authorities of staging large-scale joint military exercises with the U.S. last year, persistently aggravating the situation on the peninsula.
					
					 Recently they held negotiations for tightening the military nexus with Japan despite the strong protest of all the fellow countrymen, thus arousing concern about a dangerous arms race in Northeast Asia, it charged.
					
					 All facts go to prove that if the military tension is not defused, it is bound to lead to a war which will entail catastrophic consequences, it warned, stressing that dialogue and negotiations with the north is the only way for achieving peace on the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: DPRK's Proposal for Dialogue and Negotiations Supported in Peru
articles.content:
DPRK's Proposal for Dialogue and Negotiations Supported in Peru 
 Pyongyang, January 30 (KCNA) -- The proposal of the DPRK for improving the inter-Korean relations is the wisest and most magnanimous one, said the People's Front of Workers, Peasants and Students of Peru in a statement on Jan. 19.
					 The important proposal of the DPRK is hailed as a wise initiative because the issue of the inter-Korean relations can never be solved through confrontation but it will only lead to armed clash and war, the statement added.
					
					 The Front will wage a dynamic nationwide and international solidarity movement for improvement of the inter-Korean relations and promotion of peace in Korea, it declared.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Posted on Internet Homepage of Peruvian Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Posted on Internet Homepage of Peruvian Organization
 Pyongyang, January 30 (KCNA) -- The Peruvian-Korean Institute of Culture and Friendship posted the full text of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "On Preserving the Juche Character and National Character of the Revolution and Construction" on its Internet homepage on January 23.
					 The work, published on June 19, Juche 86 (1997), clarifies the idea that preserving the Juche character and national character of the revolution and construction is the fundamental principle that should be maintained in accomplishing the socialist cause and the tasks and ways to do so.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birthday Celebrated in Different Countries
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birthday Celebrated in Different Countries
Pyongyang, January 30 (KCNA) -- Events took place in different countries between Jan. 18 and 20 on the occasion of the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il. They included a meeting in Venezuela, a seminar, film show and photo exhibition in Ethiopia and a lecture in Thailand.
					 Films shown included Korean films "Reply of Korea" and "Korea Shining with Time-honored History."
					
					 The organizational secretary of the Communist Party of Venezuela said that under the leadership of Kim Jong Il the Korean people are firmly defending the sovereignty and dignity of the country against all sorts of aggression and provocation by the imperialists.
					
					 The chiefs of branches of the Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea noted that Kim Jong Il has developed the DPRK into an invincible socialist state and powerfully aroused the people to build a thriving nation with his extraordinary ideological and theoretical activities and energetic leadership.
					
					 Songchit Pullarp, chairman of the Organization for the Study of the Juche Idea of Thailand, said that Kim Jong Il formulated long ago the revolutionary idea of President Kim Il Sung as an integral system of the ideology, theories and methods of Juche and provided energetic leadership to enable the Workers' Party of Korea to demonstrate its dignity and might as the eternal party of the President and as an experienced and tested party.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birthday to Be Celebrated in India and Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birthday to Be Celebrated in India and Russia 
Pyongyang, January 30 (KCNA) -- An Indian national preparatory committee and a Russian preparatory committee for celebrating February 16, the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il, were formed on Jan. 24 and 21.
					 Chairman of the All India Indo-Korean Friendship Association P. Shiv Shankar, former foreign minister, and Anatoli Dolgachev, chairman of the Far Eastern Association for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Songun Policy of Russia who is first secretary of the Maritime Territorial Regional Committee of the Young Communist League of the Russian Federation, were elected chairmen of the preparatory committees.
					
					 The committees decided to hold colorful political and cultural events on the occasion.
